responses: Purchase Requisition (MPR) is an internal request to procure materials in specific quantities within a specific timeframe. It is raised by the user department and approved before converting to a Purchase Order. It helps organizations plan and control purchases efficiently.

Here are the main types of Purchase Requisitions (PR):

1. Material Purchase Request (MPR) - For raw materials, stock items, consumables, etc.
2. Service Purchase Request (SPR) - For services like maintenance, software, consultants.
3. Capital Purchase Request (CPR) - For machinery, infrastructure, or long-term assets.
4. Petty Purchase Request (PPR) - For small, low-cost purchases.
5. Urgent Purchase Request (UPR) - For time-sensitive or emergency procurements.

To Create the Purchase Requisition follow the steps below:

üîπ Navigation Path: IFS Distribution ‚Üí Purchasing ‚Üí Purchase Requisition ‚Üí Purchase Requisition screen

1. Press New Button.
2. Select the Prefix for Purchase Requisition number generation from the List of Values (LOV).
3. Select the Order Code from the LOV: 0 for Tender and 1 for Normal order. (Default is 1 if not selected).
4. Select Requisitioner from the LOV and the corresponding department will be displayed.
5. Select Internal Destination from the LOV.
6. Save the Purchase Requisition. A new requisition number will be generated based on the selected or default prefix.
7. Purchase Requisition will now be in 'Planned' status.
8. Right-click (RMB) on the Header and select Pre-posting.
9. Select Project and Project Class from the LOV and click OK.
10. Enter Document Text at header level using RMB. Click New under Output Type, search for MPR%, and select the output format.

11. Enter additional header notes like MPR REA PT (Reason), MPR SPL NT (Special Notes), MPR TM-CON (Terms & Conditions), MPR-DT REQ (Required Date), MPR-PER (Landed Cost %), MPR_BGTCOD (Budget Code), MPR_SOURCE (Source Type), MPR_SUPLDT (Supplier Lead Time).
12. Go to PR Line tab and click New. Enter the Part Number from the LOV. The LOV shows only parts with supplier-part relationships.
13. Enter the Quantity required.
14. Set the Wanted Receipt Date. The system will auto-pick primary supplier and base price or allow manual selection.
15. If Unit Price needs to be changed, update it in the 'Supplier for Purchase Part Price' section.
16. Enter additional records in PR Line as required by repeating steps 12 to 15.
17. PR Lines cannot be deleted, only canceled. Use RMB on line -> Cancel Requisition Line.
18. Make the Supplier Active/Inactive for the first line under 'Supplier for Purchase Part'.
19. RMB on Header and click 'Make Supplier Active'. This updates the status for all lines in the MPR.

Here‚Äôs how you can make changes or cancel a Purchase Requisition (MPR):

A Tender Enquiry is a document or electronic notification issued by HAL to potential suppliers through the IFS system, requesting them to submit offers or quotations for specific materials, equipment, or services.

Here are the main types of Tenders used in procurement:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Open Tender ‚Äì Invitation is open to all interested vendors. Most transparent and competitive method.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Limited Tender ‚Äì Sent only to pre-qualified or registered vendors. Used for repeat purchases or trusted suppliers.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Single Tender ‚Äì Only one vendor is invited. Used for proprietary or single-source items.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Two-Bid System ‚Äì Vendors submit Technical and Financial bids separately. Technical evaluation is done before opening price bids.
5Ô∏è‚É£ Global Tender ‚Äì Issued to international vendors for high-value or specialized imports.
6Ô∏è‚É£ E-Tender ‚Äì Entire tendering process is conducted electronically (via IFS or e-Procurement portals).
7Ô∏è‚É£ Proprietary Tender ‚Äì Used for patented or single-manufacturer items.
8Ô∏è‚É£ Rate Contract Tender ‚Äì Used to fix rates for frequently purchased items over a time period.
9Ô∏è‚É£ Expression of Interest (EOI) ‚Äì Initial step to shortlist interested vendors before the formal tender process.

To create a Tender Enquiry, follow the steps below:

üîπ Navigation Path: IFS Distribution ‚Üí Purchasing ‚Üí Tendering ‚Üí Tender Entry screen

üìã Steps:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Press New button or F5.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Select the Site from where the tender is to be created.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Choose the Tender Prefix (e.g. requisition_no/HBK or HBS).
4Ô∏è‚É£ Select Tender Mode from LOV (e.g. Advertisement, Limited Tender).
5Ô∏è‚É£ Choose Signing Authority, Authorizer, and Coordinator.
6Ô∏è‚É£ Enter the Effective Date and No. of Days after which bids open.
7Ô∏è‚É£ Choose the Currency and conversion rate (1 for INR, foreign rates pulled on tender open date).
8Ô∏è‚É£ Bid Close/Open dates auto-populate from Basic Data for Tender screen.
9Ô∏è‚É£ Press Save ‚Äî status becomes Entered.
üîü RMB on Header ‚Üí Document Text ‚Üí add RFQ output types like RFQ TRM CO, RFQ-TC-PR1.
1Ô∏è‚É£1Ô∏è‚É£ RMB on Details Tab ‚Üí Select Purchase Requisition Lines.
1Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ In the MPR Lines popup, choose the correct PR number and press OK.
1Ô∏è‚É£3Ô∏è‚É£ Save the selected lines.
1Ô∏è‚É£4Ô∏è‚É£ RMB ‚Üí Select Vendors ‚Üí pick vendors from list or add manually.
1Ô∏è‚É£5Ô∏è‚É£ Press Approve, then Issue ‚Üí status changes to Issued.

üì§ RFQ is now sent to all selected suppliers.

patterns: what to do before tender enquiry
responses:
Before initiating a Tender Enquiry, ensure the following pre-requisites are met:

‚úîÔ∏è A Purchase Requisition (PR) must be created with Order Code 0 (Tender).
‚úîÔ∏è Basic Data for Tender Entry must be properly defined in the system.

These steps ensure that the tendering process is aligned with system and policy requirements.

To send or float a Tender Enquiry, follow these steps:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Create a Purchase Requisition (PR) / Indent ‚Äì Ensure it's for the required item or service.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Approve the Requisition ‚Äì The indent must be reviewed and approved by:
‚ÄÉ‚úîÔ∏è Technical Department (to verify technical specs)
‚ÄÉ‚úîÔ∏è Finance (for budget and funding concurrence)
3Ô∏è‚É£ Create a Tender Enquiry in the IFS system via the Tender Entry screen.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Select Vendors by using RMB ‚Üí Select Vendors. You can include all connected vendors or add more.
5Ô∏è‚É£ Attach Documents (if required) like specs, terms, special instructions.
6Ô∏è‚É£ Float / Send the Tender by clicking Approve and then Issue.
7Ô∏è‚É£ Monitor and Track Responses through the Tender Status screens to follow up on vendor quotations.

‚úÖ Once issued, the Tender is officially floated to selected vendors and open for response.

A Bid in a Tender process refers to the response submitted by a supplier/vendor against a Tender Enquiry.

Tender Bid terms include important information such as:
‚úîÔ∏è Parts to be Supplied
‚úîÔ∏è Delivery Terms
‚úîÔ∏è Shipping Details
‚úîÔ∏è Payment Terms

‚úÖ It represents the supplier's official offer to fulfill the tendered requirement.

To enter or record bids received from vendors against a Tender Enquiry:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to the Tender Entry screen in the IFS system.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Right-click (RMB) on the Header section.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Select the option Bid Receive.

‚úÖ Once this is done, the status of the Tender will change to 'Bid Received', indicating that vendor responses have been captured in the system.

After bids have been received from vendors, follow this process:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Evaluate the Bids ‚Äì This includes:
‚ÄÉ‚úîÔ∏è Technical Evaluation (manual review of specifications, capabilities, compliance)
‚ÄÉ‚úîÔ∏è Commercial Evaluation (comparison of pricing, delivery, terms)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Once evaluation is complete, generate the CST Report (Comparative Statement of Tenders).
3Ô∏è‚É£ Based on the CST, the L1 Supplier (lowest technically acceptable bid) is identified.

‚úÖ These evaluations ensure transparent and cost-effective procurement aligned with technical requirements.
